articles.headline: ‘Virginia Is the Test Case’: Youngkin Pushes for G.O.P. Takeover This Fall
articles.snippet: Glenn Youngkin, a popular Republican governor with national ambitions, is trying to help his party take full control of state government in crucial legislative races this year.
articles.abstract: Glenn Youngkin, a popular Republican governor with national ambitions, is trying to help his party take full control of state government in crucial legislative races this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Virginia, whose off-year elections are usually closely watched as an indicator of the national mood, has been mostly out of the spotlight this year, overshadowed by the Republican presidential primary and the looming general election clash.

articles.headline: China Sows Disinformation About Hawaii Fires Using New Techniques
articles.snippet: Beijing’s influence campaign using artificial intelligence is a rapid change in tactics, researchers from Microsoft and other organizations say.
articles.abstract: Beijing’s influence campaign using artificial intelligence is a rapid change in tactics, researchers from Microsoft and other organizations say.
articles.lead_paragraph: When wildfires swept across Maui last month with destructive fury, China’s increasingly resourceful information warriors pounced.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Fury as Quake Help Finally Arrives: ‘How Many Hours Has It Been?’
articles.snippet: The people of a village high in the Atlas Mountains erupted in anger when the Moroccan government left them alone for three days to dig out and bury their loved ones.
articles.abstract: The people of a village high in the Atlas Mountains erupted in anger when the Moroccan government left them alone for three days to dig out and bury their loved ones.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the earth seized his house and shook it late Friday night, Mohamed Abarada ran outside with his 9-month-old daughter in his arms. His mother, his wife and his 9-year-old daughter were still inside, trapped.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee, Aida Alami, Yassine Oulhiq and Sergey Ponomarev

articles.headline: A Rush to Build Defenses in Europe, but Little Consensus on How
articles.snippet: A push by more than 30 allied countries to arm themselves, precipitated in part by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, has raised concerns of disorganization and supply shortages.
articles.abstract: A push by more than 30 allied countries to arm themselves, precipitated in part by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, has raised concerns of disorganization and supply shortages.
articles.lead_paragraph: At Saab’s sprawling combat production center in Karlskoga, Sweden, the 84-millimeter shells that can take out a battle tank in a single stroke are carefully assembled by hand. One worker stacked tagliatelle-shaped strips of explosive propellant in a tray. Another attached the translucent sheafs around the rotating fins of a guiding system.

articles.headline: TikTok Popularizes Products. Can It Sell Them, Too?
articles.snippet: The company is beginning to introduce TikTok Shop to all of the app’s users in the U.S., hoping to add a major new revenue stream.
articles.abstract: The company is beginning to introduce TikTok Shop to all of the app’s users in the U.S., hoping to add a major new revenue stream.
articles.lead_paragraph: TikTok wooed marketers from companies like Madewell, H&M and Gucci last Wednesday as part of New York Fashion Week, transforming the stylish East Village restaurant Cathédrale with a video wall showcasing fashion trends like “little luxuries” and tall mannequins wearing TikTok-inspired styles.

articles.headline: Arm, a British Chip Designer, Juggles Challenges Before 2023’s Biggest I.P.O.
articles.snippet: The SoftBank-owned company, which for decades has defined how mobile phones operate, is grappling with geopolitical and commercial complexities as it prepares to go public this week.
articles.abstract: The SoftBank-owned company, which for decades has defined how mobile phones operate, is grappling with geopolitical and commercial complexities as it prepares to go public this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rene Haas, the chief executive of the chip-design powerhouse Arm, has many masters to serve.

articles.headline: Poverty Rate Soared in 2022 as Aid Ended and Prices Rose
articles.snippet: The increase in poverty reversed two years of large declines. Median income, adjusted for inflation, fell 2.3 percent to $74,580.
articles.abstract: The increase in poverty reversed two years of large declines. Median income, adjusted for inflation, fell 2.3 percent to $74,580.
articles.lead_paragraph: Poverty increased sharply last year in the United States, particularly among children, as living costs rose and federal programs that provided aid to families during the pandemic were allowed to expire.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Lydia DePillis
